homepage.intro_description: Passionate about creating intuitive user experiences, I turn ideas into tangible realities through programming.
homepage.intro_button_text: Beyond the code: discover my unique journey.
homepage.bio: After working as a nurse for 20 years, I've learned the value of <Highlight>team work</Highlight>. This experience greatly benefits me in web development. My <Highlight>rigor</Highlight> and <Highlight>listening skills</Highlight>, acquired in the medical world, guide me in every project. I know how important it is to collaborate and understand the needs of others, whether they are patients or <Highlight>website users</Highlight>. Every line of code I write reflects this <Highlight>human-centered</Highlight> approach.

projectDetails.towardsCollaboration: Towards Collaboration: How teamwork could have enriched the project

delicesCulinaires.title: Culinary Delights

description.intro: A personal project developed in React. This site presents a variety of cooking recipes.
description.objective: The main goal was to create an intuitive and responsive cooking recipe platform, while mastering state management with Redux. I also wanted to design a modular architecture with reusable components, optimize the application's performance and ensure its fluidity on all devices thanks to a responsive design.
description.challenge: The main difficulty of the project was to think about the structure to adopt for an intuitive user navigation. Conceptualizing the UI/UX required deep thought. The Figma tool allowed me to test different prototypes before arriving at the final version.
description.responsive: The site's responsiveness ensures an optimal user experience on all devices, from mobiles to desktop computers.
description.optimizationAndAccessibility: I actively sought to make this site inclusive by focusing on accessibility. Thus, I adapted the color contrasts according to WCAG standards. I also favored a custom design with minimal use of external libraries, ensuring performance and fast loadings.
collaboration: Working in a team, and especially adopting methodologies like Agile and Scrum, several improvements would have been possible for this project.
1. Regular code reviews would have ensured better quality through exchanges and knowledge sharing.
2. Collaboration during UI/UX design phases would have brought different perspectives, contributing to a richer and more refined design.
3. By collaborating with a team, we could have solicited a wider range of users to test the project, thus offering more varied feedback.
4. Task sharing would have accelerated development, with each member bringing their specific skills.

toolsAndTech: - React & React-Router-Dom: Creation and management of the user interface, including navigation.
- Redux & React-Redux: Centralized management of the application's state.
- Styled-Components: CSS-in-JS styling for custom design.
- Vite: Development tool for fast builds and efficient development.
- Figma: Design and prototyping of the UI/UX.
- Vercel: Deployment and hosting of the application.

meteoFrance.title: M√©t√©o France Homepage Clone

description.intro: This project consisted of faithfully reproducing the homepage of the M√©t√©o France site using exclusively HTML and SCSS.
description.objective: The main goal of this project was to understand and master the fundamental basics of web development. Working without frameworks or libraries, I sought to hone my skills in layout, typography, and responsiveness.
description.challenge: The biggest challenge of this project was to accurately reproduce the various design elements of the original site while ensuring compatibility across different browsers and screen sizes. This challenge allowed me to deepen my understanding of the nuances and subtleties of CSS.
description.responsive: The site's responsiveness ensures an optimal user experience on all devices, from mobiles to desktop computers.
description.optimizationAndAccessibility: In reproducing the M√©t√©o France homepage, I emphasized accessibility while respecting the original design. Through exclusive work in HTML and CSS, I optimized the site's lightness for fast loadings.
collaboration: Being an individual reproduction project, I did not collaborate with others. However, the input of a team could have offered different perspectives on layout and design, and would have allowed me to learn new tricks and techniques.

toolsAndTech: - HTML: Basic site structure and setting up main elements.
- SCSS: Customization, design, and responsive layout of the site.

fisheye.title: Accessible Website for a Photographer Platform

description.intro: Project aimed at creating an accessible website for a photographer platform.
description.objective: The main objective was to ensure the website's accessibility while writing maintainable JavaScript code.
description.challenge: The main challenge of this project was to ensure complete accessibility in compliance with WCAG standards. To overcome these challenges, I consulted WCAG recommendations, which guided me in implementing keyboard navigation and the correct use of ARIA tags. I also used accessibility verification tools and sought user feedback to ensure that these features were indeed accessible.
description.responsive: The site's responsiveness ensures an optimal user experience on all devices, from mobiles to desktop computers.
collaboration: Working in a team, and especially adopting methodologies like Agile and Scrum, several improvements would have been possible for this project.
1. Regular code reviews would have ensured better quality through exchanges and knowledge sharing.
2. Collaboration during UI/UX design phases would have brought different perspectives, contributing to a richer and more refined design.
3. By collaborating with a team, we could have solicited a wider range of users to test the project, thus offering more varied feedback.
4. Task sharing would have accelerated development, each member bringing their specific skills.
description.optimizationAndAccessibility: In terms of performance, I used Webpack to reduce loading times and offer a more responsive user experience. In parallel, I adapted color choices to be in compliance with WCAG standards, thus strengthening the site's accessibility.

toolsAndTech: - CSS: Layout and styling of the user interface.
- Webpack: Performance optimization and reduction of loading times.
- ESLint: Ensuring JavaScript code quality through static analysis.
- JavaScript: Programming language used to create client-side dynamic interactions.
- WCAG: Compliance with accessibility guidelines to make the site usable by the widest audience.
- Wave: Accessibility evaluation tool based on WCAG standards.
- Figma: Design and prototyping of the UI/UX.
- GitHub Pages: Deployment and hosting of the application.

kasa.title: Platform for peer-to-peer apartment rentals

description.intro: Project aimed at rebuilding the Kasa apartment rental platform using React and React Router.
description.objective: The primary objective was to modernize an existing application with a more recent technology stack while respecting performance and accessibility constraints.
description.challenge: The main challenge of this project was migrating from an aging ASP.NET codebase to React, ensuring compatibility and accessibility. I followed Kasa's coding guidelines to ensure code quality.
description.responsive: The site is designed to be fully responsive, ensuring a smooth user experience across all devices.
collaboration: Working in a team, particularly when adopting methodologies such as Agile and Scrum, several improvements would have been possible for this project.
1. Regular code reviews would have ensured better quality through discussions and knowledge sharing.
2. Collaboration during the UI/UX design phases would have provided different perspectives, leading to a richer and more polished design.
3. By collaborating with a team, we could have solicited a broader range of users to test the project, thus obtaining more diverse feedback.
4. Task sharing would have sped up the development, with each member bringing their specific skills.
description.optimizationAndAccessibility: As this project was an academic exercise, I was unable to modify the source images for educational reasons. This impacted the site's performance score, specifically in the Lighthouse report where it reached 92%. In a real project, I would have used image compression tools, reducing file sizes, which would have accelerated loading times. Regarding the accessibility score, the color constraints in the academic mockup prevented me from achieving a higher score. In a professional context, I would have adjusted the colors to meet WCAG standards and improve accessibility.

toolsAndTech: - Create React App tool: Creating dynamic user interfaces.
- React Router: Managing routing within the application.
- Sass: Layout and styling.
- ESLint: Used to ensure code robustness.
- Lighthouse: Measuring performance and accessibility.
- GitHub: Source code management and collaboration.

empathy.description: The user is at the heart of my approach, creating intuitive and relevant interfaces.

organization.description: From hospital work to coding, I've learned how to prioritize my tasks effectively.

adaptability.description: I love joining new teams, quickly adapting and collaborating effectively.

listening.description: I take the time to listen carefully and value every piece of feedback.

curiosity.description: Every day is a chance to learn and hone my development skills.

autonomy.description: I like taking the initiative to move projects forward effectively.

tenacity.description: I stay committed to every challenge, always seeking the optimal solution.

relationship.description: Collaboration is my strength. Together, we achieve the best results.

card3.title: Baccalaureate in Health and Social Sciences

header.bioDescription: After an enriching career as a nurse, I have transitioned into web development with a specialization in front-end. Highly motivated, I am ready to take on new challenges in this exciting field.
